snippet: The Mariners, chasing their first playoff appearance since 2001, took a step toward firming up their right-handed hitting by reaching a four-year deal with Nelson Cruz, an official confirmed.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that Seattle mariners, who have never been to the World Series, reach deal with Nelson Cruz, major leagues’ home run leader last season; agree to $57 million four-year contract; says price seems reasonable considering how badly Mariners need hitter like Cruz to contend.
lead_paragraph: The Mariners, chasing their first playoff appearance since 2001, took a step toward firming up their right-handed hitting by reaching a four-year deal with Nelson Cruz, an official confirmed.

headline.seo: Mariners and Nelson Cruz Agree on Four-Year Deal
headline.main: A Powerful Boost for a Playoff Quest
headline.print_headline: A Powerful Boost for a Playoff Quest
